channel.title: Mastodon Home Timeline
channel.description: RSS feed for the Mastodon Home timeline

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: You know how most papers suffer in journal clubs? But probably the authors have answers for many of the criticisms? Well, one of the hopes in creating PubPeer ("The online journal club") was to be a forum where authors could defend their papers. So it's great to see Beth Stevens replying to some accumulated questions on her work about synapse-pruning by microglia.https://pubpeer.com/publications/9775AFC4086EF678B10238F0594B07#19We continue to believe that public confrontation *of ideas* will accelerate scientific progress.

item.title: legraLeGra
item.description: If you cannot view the #eclipse, #nasa will have English, Spanish, and silent flavors of streaming from 1p EST. https://www.nasa.gov/news-release/how-to-watch-upcoming-total-solar-eclipse-with-nasa-from-anywhere/Einsteins #GeneralRelativity predicted that massive objects like the sun should bend light with their massive gravity. Photos of stars at night versus during an eclipse show this effect.

item.title: Fabrice Tshimanga
item.description:
@jonny @computingnature and it's not only the domain thing, the Transformers hype has a sort of mystical aspect with the mathematical properties of the attention mechanism, it's been 4 years I think of constant press treating vision transformers as the only SOTA models, with ConvNets of comparable size and compute (if not lesser, i.e. better) achieving comparable results, anyway one can put it and look at it.
The fact we call the dot-product similarity "attention mechanism" has done wonders

item.description: We are launching recruitment for #ProfessionalDevelopment Mentors for this year's Academy! NMA isn't just about cutting-edge curriculum, but also supporting our students to launch into their next career step no matter what direction they are headed. https://buff.ly/4aKzbb0

item.title: Richard Sever
item.description: Some thoughts on the new Gates OA policy. Will this be part of a general funder shift towards preprints and what does it mean for NIH/PMC? https://blogs.lse.ac.uk/impactofsocialsciences/2024/04/09/is-the-bill-and-melinda-gates-foundations-new-oa-policy-the-start-of-a-shift-towards-preprints/

item.title: David Colquhoun
item.description:
Another old friend has gone ðŸ˜§
In 1961 - 1964 we spent time in the Edinburgh Univ staff club, putting the world to rights. I discovered only later why he sometimes seemed a bit distracted -he was writing his famous papers!
The staff club vanished ages ago, the world got worse and now Peter has gone.
https://twitter.com/incunabula/status/1777735312086642935/photo/1

item.title: Moritz Negwer
item.description: Just discovered the hashtag #TextureTuesday - follow it and it will fill your timeline with pictures of interesting textures, mostly plant-based.

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description: me: "Measure it! Get the data!"David Hubel: "Those who think 'Science is Measurement' should search Darwin's works for numbers and equations."

item.title: Boris Barbour
item.description: @sls Many theories do require more than qualitative observations to be considered valuable. And, to be honest, Hubel's would be a case in point.

item.title: Greg Wilson
item.description:
1. I am moving my projects from Pandas to Polars because I believe the latter has higher performance and (more importantly) a more comfortable API.
2. If you are also doing this, please don't post things like, "Pandas is such garbageâ€”why did we put up with it for so long?" Pandas is a good tool and has served hundreds of thousands of people well; the fact that it's taken this long for a better one to emerge is a testament to the skill and dedication of its creators.

#AcademicIntegrity

item.title: Dan Goodman
item.description: Someone is proposing to delete the @briansimulator wikipedia article because the software is "not notable". Please do join the discussion if you are a wiki editor and feel that it is notable.https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Brian_(software)

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
@sls
Protheory here (when weâ€™re ready for it). But one of my favorite books that makes your point:https://academic.oup.com/book/5530?login=falseThis is where we are, I believe, w/ some things in brain/mind research. We have something akin to the Galileo thermometer.

item.title: Gareth Kitchen
item.description:
Revolut does not have a UK banking licence.

If you are a victim of fraud you'll be SOL.

Best advice; close your account and move to a conventional bank elsewhere.

Please boost to make people in the UK aware.

https://www.theguardian.com/money/2024/apr/10/im-a-victim-of-scammers-but-revolut-says-no-to-a-refund

#fraud

Edit: David Goodlad made some interesting comment on a thread under this post about other regulation where redress should be possible, worth checking out as the Guardian article maybe isn't as accurate as it should be.
